meanings.definition: To cause to lose one's mental faculties
meanings.sent1: The loud noise dements my concentration.
meanings.sent2: The illness dements his ability to remember things.
meanings.sent3: Trying to solve a puzzle while someone sings loudly can really dement you!
meanings.sent4: The constant stress slowly dements her mind like a relentless storm.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the abandoned house dements the brave explorer.

meanings.definition: To become mentally impaired or disordered
meanings.sent1: As she aged, her memory dements gradually.
meanings.sent2: The trauma from the accident dements him over time.
meanings.sent3: The mix-up in the library system can really dement your book search!
meanings.sent4: The chaotic thoughts dement his mind like a tangled web.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious potion seems to dement the villagers who drink it.
